amendment.description: Amendment sought to increase Homeless Assistance funding by $297 million and decrease NASA Human Space Flight funding for the space station by $297 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 27 as printed in the Congressional Record of June 19, 1996, to increase by $297 million (to $1.1 billion) the appropriation for HUD programs for the homeless which would restore the funding to the pre-rescission FY 1995 level. The offset for this increase would come from a reduction in the funding for the space station by $297 million.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Kennedy (MA) amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 138 - 277 (Roll no. 270).
